    java.lang.String getSymptomName()
    getSymptomName
    static SVMContext parse​(java.lang.String[] pAttributeNames, java.lang.String pFeatureVector, java.lang.String pDelimiter)
    parse turns a featureVector into an SVMContext The documentId is always the first column The offsets are the next set of columns The answer is always the last column - prefixed by 999_ The ordering of the values comes from the ordering of the attributenames passed in otherwise.
    void setAnswer​(java.lang.String pAnswer)
    setAnswer
    void setCSVDelimiter​(java.lang.String pDelimiter)
    setCSVDelimiter sets the csv delimiter.
    java.lang.String toArffRow()
    Deprecated.
    Use the version from the contexts instead so that the enumerations can be on-the-fly calculated and filtered to "unknown" if there are not enough frequency for the the words in postion attributes
    java.lang.String toCSVRow()
    toCSVRow returns a pipe delimited row of values, the ordering determined by the sorted/alphebetical ordering of the attribute names (which should be prefaced by zero delimited numbers) The documentId is always the first column The offsets are the next set of columns The answer is always the last column
    java.lang.String toFeatureVectorString()
    toFeatureVectorString creates a String that is the set of line feature vectors If there is a pipe in any of the values, they get transformed to ~ and newlines into spaces.

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      pAnswerValue - - the value of the answer in String form

    • getCSVHeader

      public java.lang.String getCSVHeader()
      getCSVHeader returns a pipe delimited line with the column headings in it The ordering comes from the natural ordering that comes back from the hash.keySet()
      Returns:
      String

    • toCSVRow

      public final java.lang.String toCSVRow()
      toCSVRow returns a pipe delimited row of values, the ordering determined by the sorted/alphebetical ordering of the attribute names (which should be prefaced by zero delimited numbers) The documentId is always the first column The offsets are the next set of columns The answer is always the last column
      Returns:
      String

    • toFeatureVectorString

      public java.lang.String toFeatureVectorString()
      toFeatureVectorString creates a String that is the set of line feature vectors If there is a pipe in any of the values, they get transformed to ~ and newlines into spaces.
      Returns:
      String values that are ordered by the name (which are prefixed by numbers)

    • toArffRow

      public final java.lang.String toArffRow()
      Deprecated.
      Use the version from the contexts instead so that the enumerations can be on-the-fly calculated and filtered to "unknown" if there are not enough frequency for the the words in postion attributes
      toArffRow

    • setCSVDelimiter

      public final void setCSVDelimiter​(java.lang.String pDelimiter)
      setCSVDelimiter sets the csv delimiter. By default, it's a pipe.
      Parameters:
      pDelimeter -

    • getCSVDelimiter

      public final java.lang.String getCSVDelimiter()
      getCSVDelimiter sets the csv delimiter.
      Returns:
      String

    • parse

      public static final SVMContext parse​(java.lang.String[] pAttributeNames, java.lang.String pFeatureVector, java.lang.String pDelimiter)
      parse turns a featureVector into an SVMContext The documentId is always the first column The offsets are the next set of columns The answer is always the last column - prefixed by 999_ The ordering of the values comes from the ordering of the attributenames passed in otherwise. The offsets are one field with begin and end offset delimited by a ~
      Parameters:
      pAttributeNames -
      pFeatureVector -
      Returns:
      SVMContext

    • createFeatureVectorHeader

      public static final java.lang.String createFeatureVectorHeader​(java.lang.String[] pFeatureVectorNames, java.lang.String pFeatureVectorDelimiter)
      createFeatureVectorHeader returns a String of the featureNames delimited by the delimiter.
      Parameters:
      pFeatureVectorNames -
      pFeatureVectorDelimiter -
      Returns:
      String
